name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: a summary of this course.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: This map shows the major topics we have covered in this course.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And here are some key high-level take-away messages.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: First we talk about natural language content analysis.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Here the main take-away message is natural language processing is the foundation for

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _textual retrieval
column6: but current NLP isn't robust enough. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: So the back of words replenishing is generally

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: the main method used in modern search engines and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: it's often sufficient for most of the search tasks.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _But obviously
column6: for more compass search tasks

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: then we need a deeper measurement processing techniques.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And we then talked about a high-level strategies for

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: text access and we talked about push versus pull in plural.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _We talked about a query
column6: which is browsing. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _Now
column6: in general in future search engines

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: all these techniques to provide a multiple information access and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: then we talked about a number of issues related to search engines.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We talked about the search problem and we framed that as a ranking problem and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: we talked about the a number of retrieval methods.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We start with an overview of the vector space model and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: probabilistic model and then we talked about the vector space model in that.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We also later talked about leverageable learning approach and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: that's probabilistic model.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _And here
column6: the main take-away message is that model retrieval functions tend to _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: look similar and they generally use various heuristics.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Most important ones are TF-IDF waiting document length normalization and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: that TF is often transformed through a sub-linear transformation function and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: then we talked about how to implement a retrieval system.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And here the main technique that we talked about how to construct an inverted index.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: So that we can prepare the system to answer a query quickly and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _we talked about how to
column6: to fast research by using the inverted index and _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: we then talked about how to evaluate the text retrieval system

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: mainly introduced the Cranfield evaluation methodology.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: This was a very important the various methodology of that can be applied to

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: many tasks.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We talked about the major evaluation measures.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: So the most important measures for

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: a search engine are MAP mean average precision and nDCG.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Normalized discounted accumulative gain and also precision and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: record the two basic measures.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And we then talked about feedback techniques.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And we talked about the rock you in the vector space model and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: the mixture model in the language modeling approach.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Feedback is very important technique especially considering

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: the opportunity of learning from a lot of pixels on the web.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We then talked about the web search.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _And here
column6: we talk about the how to use parallel indexing to resolve _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _the scalability issue in indexing
column6: we introduce a MapReduce and _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: then we talked about the how to using information interacting pull search.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We talked about page random

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: hits as the major algorithms to analyze links on the web.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We then talked about learning to rank.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: This is a use of machine learning to combine multiple features for

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: improving scoring.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Not only the effectiveness can be improved using this approach but

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _we can also improve the robustness of the ranking function

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _so that it's not easy to spam a search engine with just a

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: a some features to promote a page.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _And finally
column6: we talked about the future of web search. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: We talked about some major interactions that we might assume

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: in the future in improving the current generation of search engines.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _And then finally
column6: we talked about the Recommender System and these are systems _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: to implement the push mode and we'll talk about the two approaches.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _One is content based
column6: one is collaborative filtering and _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: they can be combined together.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Now an obvious missing piece in this

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _picture is the user
column6: you can see. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _So user interface is also a important component in any search engine

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: even though the current search interface is relatively simple.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: There actually have been a lot of studies of user interfaces

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _related to visualization for example and this is topic to that

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: you can learn more by reading this book.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: It's a excellent book about all kind of studies of search user interface.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _If you want to know more about the
column6: the topics that we talked about

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: you can also read some additional readings that are listed here.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _In this short course
column6: we are only managing to cover some basic topics in text _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: retrieval in search engines.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And these resources provide additional information about more advanced topics and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: they give more thorough treatment of some of the topics that we talked about.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And a main source is synthesis digital library

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: where you can see a lot of short textbook or

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: textbooks or long tutorials.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: They tend to provide us with a lot of information to explain a topic and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: there are multiple series that are related to this course.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _One is information concepts
column6: retrieval and services. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Another is human Language technology and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _yet
column6: another is artificial intelligence and machine learning. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: There are also some major journals and conferences listed over here that

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: tend to have a lot of research papers related to the topic of this course.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And finally for

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _more information about resources including readings and tool kits
column6: etc. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: You can check out this URL.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _So
column6: if you have not taken the text mining course in this _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _in this data mining specialization series

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _then naturally
column6: the next step is to take that calls. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _As this picture shows to mine the text data

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: we generally need two kinds of techniques.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _One is text retrieval
column6: which is covered in this course. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _And these techniques will help us convert raw big text data into small

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _relevant text data
column6: which are actually needed in the specific application. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _And human plays important role in mining any text data

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: because text data is written for humans to consume.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _So
column6: involving humans in the process of data mining is very important. _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _And in this course
column6: we have covered various strategies to _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: help users get access to the most relevant data.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: These techniques are also essential in any text mining system to help

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: provide providence and to help users interpret the inner

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: patterns that the user would find through text data mining.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _So
column6: in general
column7: the user would have to go back to the original data to better _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: understand the patterns.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _So the text mining course or rather text mining and ana

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _analytics course will be deal

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: dealing with what to do once the user has found the information.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: So this is a in this picture where we would convert

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: the text data into action or knowledge.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: And this has to do with helping users to go further digest with

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: a found information or to find the patterns and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: to reveal knowledge buried in text and such knowledge can be used in

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: application system to help decision-making or to help user finish a task.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: _So
column6: if you have not taken that course the natural step and _

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: the natural next step would be to take that course.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: Thank you for taking this course.

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: I hope you have found this course to be useful to you and

name: 5 - 15 - 4.8 Course Summary (00-09-48).srt
text: I look forward to interacting with you at a future activity.
